title: globalsettings.json schema
description: Structure and description of globalsettings.json settings
x-intellij-html-description: Structure and description of globalsettings.json settings

setting_example.x-intellij-html-description: Description in HTML format if needed. Works only with AndroidStudio/IntellijIDEA. This tag will be used instead of 'description' if added
setting_example.$comment1: possible types: array, boolean, integer, null, number, object, string
setting_example.pattern: ^ Regular expression for settings value check .*
setting_example.$comment3: Enum if it can be only defined values
setting_example.$comment4: MIN and MAX length for strings

note.deprecationMessage: NOT ALLOWED HERE! Please add description to schema!

mnoname.description:
TG: REGI

Unique key for operator recognition
Usually looks like OperatorName_CountryCode
mnoname.x-intellij-html-description:
TG: REGI

Unique key for operator recognition
Usually looks like OperatorName_CountryCode

rcs_network_type.description:
TG: RCS

Network type through which RCS is working
rcs_network_type.x-intellij-html-description:
TG: RCS

Network type through which RCS is working

rcs_local_config_server.description:
TG: RCS

Specify config file source 
 0 for RCS_CONFIG_SOURCE_REMOTE_SERVER 
 1 for RCS_CONFIG_SOURCE_LOCAL_SERVER 
 2 for RCS_CONFIG_SOURCE_LOCAL_FILE 
 3 for RCS_CONFIG_SOURCE_LOCAL_FILE_FROM_SDCARD
rcs_local_config_server.x-intellij-html-description:
TG: RCS

Specify config file source
0 for RCS_CONFIG_SOURCE_REMOTE_SERVER
1 for RCS_CONFIG_SOURCE_LOCAL_SERVER
2 for RCS_CONFIG_SOURCE_LOCAL_FILE
3 for RCS_CONFIG_SOURCE_LOCAL_FILE_FROM_SDCARD

rcs_custom_config_server_url.description:
TG: RCS

Operator specific auto configuration server URL. 
 In case of Google project, add it referring Flatfile. 
 If FQDN, not need to add
rcs_custom_config_server_url.x-intellij-html-description:
TG: RCS

Operator specific auto configuration server URL.
In case of Google project, add it referring Flatfile.
If FQDN, not need to add

rcs_pre_consent.description:
TG: RCS

If it has value 1 (true), than RCS ToC, MSISDN dialogs will be displayed by Message UI 
 and autoconf won't start until user accepts ToC in Message UI (once this happens, UI initiates autoconf and regi by calling {@link ImsManager#sendTryRegister()}.
 If value is 0 (false), then autoconf and registration should proceed as before (without involving Message UI). 
 This parameter is supposed to be used only with Google (Jibe) Guest Cloud servers. 
 In code, default value is 0 (false)
rcs_pre_consent.x-intellij-html-description:
TG: RCS

If it has value 1 (true), than RCS ToC, MSISDN dialogs will be displayed by Message UI
and autoconf won't start until user accepts ToC in Message UI (once this happens, UI initiates autoconf and regi by calling {@link ImsManager#sendTryRegister()}.
If value is 0 (false), then autoconf and registration should proceed as before (without involving Message UI).
This parameter is supposed to be used only with Google (Jibe) Guest Cloud servers.
In code, default value is 0 (false)

rcs_min_gms_core_version.description:
TG: RCS

Minimal required Google Play Services package version for use with Google (Jibe) Guest Cloud servers. 
 Should be int.
 Translation to Play Services package version can be found in 
 SamsungMessages/Message/src/main/java/com/samsung/android/messaging/ui/view/firstlaunch/GoogleFirstLaunchManager.java 
 class on Package Git repository. 
 Add it referring Flatfile. If N/A, not need to add
rcs_min_gms_core_version.x-intellij-html-description:
TG: RCS

Minimal required Google Play Services package version for use with Google (Jibe) Guest Cloud servers.
Should be int.
Translation to Play Services package version can be found in
SamsungMessages/Message/src/main/java/com/samsung/android/messaging/ui/view/firstlaunch/GoogleFirstLaunchManager.java
class on Package Git repository.
Add it referring Flatfile. If N/A, not need to add

rcs_otp_sms_type.description:
TG: RCS

SMS format to receive the OTP value, see RCC.14. 
 Google project: refer the flatfile(if 'binary', no need to add). 
 For non-Google project: 'binary'(no need to add)
rcs_otp_sms_type.x-intellij-html-description:
TG: RCS

SMS format to receive the OTP value, see RCC.14.
Google project: refer the flatfile(if 'binary', no need to add).
For non-Google project: 'binary'(no need to add)

rcs_otp_sms_port.description:
TG: RCS

Indicates support of application port addressing via the SMS User Data Header (UDH) for the validation of user identification data through an OTP, see RCC.14 SMS_port
rcs_otp_sms_port.x-intellij-html-description:
TG: RCS

Indicates support of application port addressing via the SMS User Data Header (UDH) for the validation of user identification data through an OTP, see RCC.14 SMS_port

rcs_otp_sms_regex.description:
TG: RCS

The regular expression to parse OTP out of text MT SMS during RCS provisioning. This regular expression should be active only when Samsung's RCS client is expecting the validation OTP.
rcs_otp_sms_regex.x-intellij-html-description:
TG: RCS

The regular expression to parse OTP out of text MT SMS during RCS provisioning. This regular expression should be active only when Samsung's RCS client is expecting the validation OTP.
examples: your verification code for rcs messaging

rcs_regex_to_hide.description:
TG: RCS

The regular expression to hide both MT and MO SMS. This regular expression should be active all the time.
rcs_regex_to_hide.x-intellij-html-description:
TG: RCS

The regular expression to hide both MT and MO SMS. This regular expression should be active all the time.
examples: Google is verifying your number for Chat features [a-zA-Z0-9]{10}

rcs_ft_chunk_size.description:
TG: RCS

Messages sent using MSRP can be very large and can be delivered in several SEND requests, where each SEND request contains one chunk of the overall message - see rfc4975. 
 TODO !! default in globalsettings is 10240 in code is 0

msrp_cema.description:
TG: RCS

The CEMA extension is backward compatible, meaning that CEMA-enabled
   MSRP endpoints can communicate with non-CEMA-enabled endpoints. 
 See more https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc6714
msrp_cema.x-intellij-html-description:
TG: RCS

The CEMA extension is backward compatible, meaning that CEMA-enabled
MSRP endpoints can communicate with non-CEMA-enabled endpoints.
See more https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc6714

msrp_discard_port.description:
TG: RCS

According to [RFC6135] and in accordance with [RFC4145], if the a=setup attribute value is "active", the port number value should be 9 (discard port).
msrp_discard_port.x-intellij-html-description:
TG: RCS

According to [RFC6135] and in accordance with [RFC4145], if the a=setup attribute value is "active", the port number value should be 9 (discard port).

support_chat_on_default_mms_app.description:
TG: RCS

Specify if autoconfig should start when changing messaging app from non-Samsung to Samsung one. 
 1 : Re-registration 
 2: Deregistration and autoconfig for RCS dual registration 
 3: Deregistration and init-registration 
 4: Removes messages and stat autoconfiguration with delay 
 5: Re-registration and autoconfig 
 other: do nothing
support_chat_on_default_mms_app.x-intellij-html-description:
TG: RCS

Specify if autoconfig should start when changing messaging app from non-Samsung to Samsung one.
1 : Re-registration
2: Deregistration and autoconfig for RCS dual registration
3: Deregistration and init-registration
4: Removes messages and stat autoconfiguration with delay
5: Re-registration and autoconfig
other: do nothing

voice_domain_pref_eutran.description:
TG: REGI

Describes voice domain preference for E-UTRAN
-1 - not used, 1 - CSVoiceOnly, 2 - CSVoicePreferred, 3 - IMSPSVoicePreferred, 4 - IMSPSVoiceOnly
Most used are 3 or 1
This setting is usually overwritten by <Voice_Domain_Preference_EUTRAN> from customer.xml
voice_domain_pref_eutran.x-intellij-html-description:
TG: REGI

Describes voice domain preference for E-UTRAN
-1 - not used, 1 - CSVoiceOnly, 2 - CSVoicePreferred, 3 - IMSPSVoicePreferred, 4 - IMSPSVoiceOnly
Most used are 3 or 1
This setting is usually overwritten by from customer.xml

voice_domain_pref_utran.description:
TG: REGI

Describes voice domain preference for UTRAN
-1 - not used, 1 - CSVoiceOnly, 2 - CSVoicePreferred, 3 - IMSPSVoicePreferred, 4 - IMSPSVoiceOnly
This setting is almost not used!
voice_domain_pref_utran.x-intellij-html-description:
TG: REGI

This setting is almost not used!

ss_domain_setting.description:
TG: CALL

The SS_domain_setting leaf indicates the network operator's preference for the selection of the domain used by the UE when performing supplementary services (SS) setting control for voice services. 

1. CS always : Ut not supported
2. PS always : UE will use XCAP always (if PS is not registered, UE will return error).
3. PS only if VoLTE registered : UE will use XCAP only if VoLTE is registered.
4. PS only if PS is registered : UE will use XCAP when PS is registered (if PS is not registered, UE will try CS domain).
ss_domain_setting.x-intellij-html-description:
TG: CALL

The SS_domain_setting leaf indicates the network operator's preference for the selection of the domain used by the UE when performing supplementary services (SS) setting control for voice services.

1. CS always : Ut not supported
2. PS always : UE will use XCAP always (if PS is not registered, UE will return error).
3. PS only if VoLTE registered : UE will use XCAP only if VoLTE is registered.
4. PS only if PS is registered : UE will use XCAP when PS is registered (if PS is not registered, UE will try CS domain).

t_lte_911_fail.description:
TG: CALL

Timer for Emergency Call establishment. If timer run out there is a CSFB.
t_lte_911_fail.x-intellij-html-description:
TG: CALL

Timer for Emergency Call establishment. If timer run out there is a CSFB.

ussd_domain_setting.description:
TG: CALL

To allow for selection of appropriate method for UE originating USSD request delivery, the following applies for a UE when the UE supports both the USSD using IMS and the USSD using CS domain. The UE shall first attempt USSD requests in the domain used for originating voice sessions. If an attempt to deliver the USSD request using IMS fails due to missing network support and the UE is registered in the CS domain, the UE shall attempt to deliver the USSD request using the CS domain.
ussd_domain_setting.x-intellij-html-description:
TG: CALL

To allow for selection of appropriate method for UE originating USSD request delivery, the following applies for a UE when the UE supports both the USSD using IMS and the USSD using CS domain. The UE shall first attempt USSD requests in the domain used for originating voice sessions. If an attempt to deliver the USSD request using IMS fails due to missing network support and the UE is registered in the CS domain, the UE shall attempt to deliver the USSD request using the CS domain.

emergency_domain_setting.description:
TG: CALL

Emergency Service is not a subscription service and therefore, when the UE has roamed out of its home network, emergency services shall not be provided by the home network and shall be provided in the roamed-to network if the roamed-to network supports emergency sessions. If a UE has sufficient credentials, it shall initiate an emergency registration with the network (requiring the involvement of the home network). The CSCFs providing service for emergency sessions may be different from the CSCFs involved in the other IMS services. If the registration fails, the UE may attempt an anonymous emergency call.
If an emergency session establishment request is routed to a P-CSCF located in the home network, the home network should be able to detect that the session is for emergency service (whether indicated as such or not) and respond to the UE indicating that the UE should initiate an emergency session in the visited network (e.g. via the CS domain of the visited network).
emergency_domain_setting.x-intellij-html-description:
TG: CALL

Emergency Service is not a subscription service and therefore, when the UE has roamed out of its home network, emergency services shall not be provided by the home network and shall be provided in the roamed-to network if the roamed-to network supports emergency sessions. If a UE has sufficient credentials, it shall initiate an emergency registration with the network (requiring the involvement of the home network). The CSCFs providing service for emergency sessions may be different from the CSCFs involved in the other IMS services. If the registration fails, the UE may attempt an anonymous emergency call.
If an emergency session establishment request is routed to a P-CSCF located in the home network, the home network should be able to detect that the session is for emergency service (whether indicated as such or not) and respond to the UE indicating that the UE should initiate an emergency session in the visited network (e.g. via the CS domain of the visited network).

no_sim_emergency_domain_setting.description:
TG: CALL

In case of a SIM-less emergency call, or in case of a non-registered (U)SIM emergency call, a non-dialable callbacknumber shall be used to identify the target UE. The format and structure of the non-dialable callback number is according to national or regional regulations. The non-dialable callback number in North America shall, according to J-STD-036 [32], be the digits 911 + the last 7 digits of IMEI expressed in decimal numbers.
no_sim_emergency_domain_setting.x-intellij-html-description:
TG: CALL

In case of a SIM-less emergency call, or in case of a non-registered (U)SIM emergency call, a non-dialable callbacknumber shall be used to identify the target UE. The format and structure of the non-dialable callback number is according to national or regional regulations. The non-dialable callback number in North America shall, according to J-STD-036 [32], be the digits 911 + the last 7 digits of IMEI expressed in decimal numbers.

TG: CALL

0: enabled

ss_disconnect_xcap_pdn.description:
TG: CALL

Enables disconnection of the xcap PDN by UE. If disabled, it will be disconnected only by NW.

TG: SS

Id of barring outgoing communication XCAP rule.

Id of barring outgoing communication XCAP rule.

Reference: 3GPP TS 24.315

Id of barring outgoing international communication XCAP rule.

ss_403_csfb_until_reboot.description:
TG: SS

If the UE receives an error on the network, the SS request goes through the CS domain until the device is rebooted.

TG: SS

If the UE receives an error on the network, the SS request goes through the CS domain until the device is rebooted.

TG: SS

When boot completed, get the supplementary service information automatically
ss_is_need_get_first.x-intellij-html-description:
TG: SS

When boot completed, get the supplementary service information automatically

ss_need_seperate_CFNL.description:
TG: SS

Indicates whether CFNL rule is supported. When supported makes the single rule and transmit call-forwarding-not-logged separately.
ss_need_seperate_CFNL.x-intellij-html-description:
TG: SS

Indicates whether CFNL rule is supported. When supported makes the single rule and transmit call-forwarding-not-logged separately.

ss_need_seperate_CFNRy.description:
TG: SS

Makes the single rule and transmit call-forwarding-not-reachable separately. When this feature is enabled, the timer for CFNR will be sent separately
ss_need_seperate_CFNRy.x-intellij-html-description:
TG: SS

Makes the single rule and transmit call-forwarding-not-reachable separately. When this feature is enabled, the timer for CFNR will be sent separately

ss_need_seperate_CFA.description:
TG: SS

Makes the single rule and transmit all conditions separately.
ss_need_seperate_CFA.x-intellij-html-description:
TG: SS

Makes the single rule and transmit all conditions separately.

ss_error_msg_display.description:
TG: SS

If UE receives an error on the network containing the phrase, UE displays an error pop-up containing the error string
ss_error_msg_display.x-intellij-html-description:
TG: SS

If UE receives an error on the network containing the phrase, UE displays an error pop-up containing the error string

ss_no_media_for_CB.description:
TG: SS

This feature should be only enabled, when ss_support_media_type is set to 0 (media are enabled for SS) and operator only does not support media for call barring. Then device will only send voice information in call barring rule

TG: SS

This feature should be only enabled, when ss_support_media_type is set to 0 (media are enabled for SS) and operator only does not support media for call barring. Then device will only send voice information in call barring rule

vowifi_operator_label_ongoing.description:
TG: REGI

Enable ongoing notification when VoWiFi registered.
Ongoing means that the notification cannot be dismissed by the user.
Possible values: 0 (disabled), 1 (enabled).
Default value: 0 (disabled).

e911_pdn_selection_vowifi.description:
TG: CALL

Preference for emergency calls when VoWiFi is registered

1. : 
CS only
emergency_domain_setting: "CS"

2. : 
Use emergency pdn for E-Call
emergency_domain_setting: "PS"
e911_pdn_selection_vowifi: 0

3. : 
Use WiFi even if LTE is available
emergency_domain_setting: "PS"
e911_pdn_selection_vowifi: 2

4. : 
Use WiFi only if devise is out of service
emergency_domain_setting: "PS"
e911_pdn_selection_vowifi: 1
e911_pdn_selection_vowifi.x-intellij-html-description:
TG: CALL

Preference for emergency calls when VoWiFi is registered

1. :
CS only
emergency_domain_setting: "CS"

2. :
Use emergency pdn for E-Call
emergency_domain_setting: "PS"
e911_pdn_selection_vowifi: 0

3. :
Use WiFi even if LTE is available
emergency_domain_setting: "PS"
e911_pdn_selection_vowifi: 2

4. :
Use WiFi only if devise is out of service
emergency_domain_setting: "PS"
e911_pdn_selection_vowifi: 1

TG: RCS

Specify platform on which RCS is running. 
 Among Google projects, it should be added for buyer that is supported as UP. 
 Otherwise it is not needed
 Need to be deleted for jibe CPR

enable_default_sms_fallback.description:
TG: CALL

MS is preferred to be invoked over IP networks: the UE attempts to deliver SMS over IP networks. If
delivery of SMS over IP networks is not available, the UE attempts to deliver SMS over NAS signalling.
enable_default_sms_fallback.x-intellij-html-description:
TG: CALL

MS is preferred to be invoked over IP networks: the UE attempts to deliver SMS over IP networks. If
delivery of SMS over IP networks is not available, the UE attempts to deliver SMS over NAS signalling.

support_notification_for_TnC.description:
TG: RCS

Specify if notification about using RCS and accepting it can be dismissed to notification bar
support_notification_for_TnC.x-intellij-html-description:
TG: RCS

Specify if notification about using RCS and accepting it can be dismissed to notification bar

rcs_default_enabled.description:
TG: RCS

1- RCS enabled by default
0- RCS disable by default
-1 - Guest cloud -related setting - RCS will hold autoconfig until triggered by Messaging app. User has to accept Google's T&C first.
  If rcs_pre_consent is 1, this has to be -1
rcs_default_enabled.x-intellij-html-description:
TG: RCS

1- RCS enabled by default
0- RCS disable by default
-1 - Guest cloud -related setting - RCS will hold autoconfig until triggered by Messaging app. User has to accept Google's T&C first.
If rcs_pre_consent is 1, this has to be -1

rcs_provisioning_version.description: This parameter sets the RCS ACS Http provisioning_version param value. Default is 2.0, which corresponds to UP_1.0 / UP_T profile. UP_2.0 profiles should have provisioning_version param set to 4.0. Blackbird and CPR profiles should leave the parameter empty string, as this Http param was introduced for UP_1.0
rcs_provisioning_version.x-intellij-html-description: This parameter sets the RCS ACS Http provisioning_version param value.</br> Default value is 2.0, which corresponds to UP_1.0 / UP_T profile. </br>UP_2.0 profiles should have provisioning_version param set to 4.0. </br>Blackbird and CPR profiles should leave the parameter empty string, as this Http param was introduced for UP_1.0

alt_provisioning_versions.description: This parameter sets alternate prov versions supported by operator. Default is empty, if operator has any alternate acs provisioning version supported, they need to be mentioned. These values will be compared against Supported-Version http header value received in ACS response. Maintain this array in descending order of(Ex: 4.0,3.0) acs prov versions client supporting

rcs_app_list.description: This parameter sets the RCS ACS Http multiple app param values. Empty list is a default value. This param was made mandatory for UP_2.0 and newer profiles. Blackbird, CPR, UP_T and UP_1.0 profiles should leave the parameter as an empty list.
rcs_app_list.x-intellij-html-description: This parameter sets the RCS ACS Http multiple app param values.</br>Empty list is a default value. This param was made mandatory for UP_2.0 and newer profiles.</br>Blackbird, CPR, UP_T and UP_1.0 profiles should leave the parameter as an empty list.

ignore_display_name.description:
TG: CALL

If enabled the incoming call number will not be taken from "display name" value from P-Asserted-Identity or From fields and will use number from URI instead
ignore_display_name.x-intellij-html-description:
TG: CALL

If enabled EU ignores display name value from P-Asserted-Identity and From fields and will use number from URI instead

default_rcs_volte_registration.description:
TG: RCS

This parameter specifies default value of autoconfiguration parameter 'rcsVolteSingleRegistration' (see RCC.07 v11.0, section A.3.2) for an operator.
As per specifications, the default value is 1.
However, we are allowing operator customization for this default value.
If the value is set to -1, the received value of 'rcsVolteSingleRegistration' is ignored and single/dual registration is performed based on profiles in imsprofile.json.
Before enabling, ensure that there are two profiles for the operator, one for VoLTE only and other for RCS only.
default_rcs_volte_registration.x-intellij-html-description:
TG: RCS

This parameter specifies default value of autoconfiguration parameter 'rcsVolteSingleRegistration' (see RCC.07 v11.0, section A.3.2) for an operator.
As per specifications, the default value is 1.
However, we are allowing operator customization for this default value.
If the value is set to -1, the received value of 'rcsVolteSingleRegistration' is ignored and single/dual registration is performed based on profiles in imsprofile.json.
Before enabling, ensure that there are two profiles for the operator, one for VoLTE only and other for RCS only.
